review: Best investment we could have ever made!!! I am so glad to not be tied to the cable box anymore. I love that you add Netflix or Hulu for the ultimate in commercial free viewing. If you are thinking of walking away from the cable company.... DO IT!! You won't regret it!
author: Donovan & Sarah Wisehart

review: I feel totally duped by this product. I needed a vehicle for mobile HBO viewing (not my Kindle Fire), and, as a Prime member, decided to try a Fire stick. Amazon has been bragging about the HBOGo app so this should have been a no-brainer. Wrong. Silly I am to assume that since I can watch HBOGo on my Kindle, I could watch it on Fire TV. Much to my chagrin Comcast, one of the largest cable providers in the country, is woefully missing from the list of providers. I really don't understand how this omission can ever occur when there seems to be deals already in place. Oh well, shame on me for not completely researching before buying.
author: Glenn Chase

review: What a difference New tech makes! I had been streaming on a roku 2 that I've had for 4 years. I decided to try out the fire stick when Sling TV offered it free with 3 months of prepaid service. The picture clarity is amazing, videos load almost immediately and I love that it's practically cordless (still has a power cord, but no nerd for component cables like my old roku).The remote is really responsive, but I'm not a major fan of the button placement. It took me neatly a week to stop mistaking the home button for the play button. Minor problem in the long run. For less than 40 bucks. I can stream from my kindle, play spotify, and watch live tv. If only comcast infinity would approve hbogo on the Fire Stick, I'd completely throw out my roku (comcast users, Showtime anytime and HBOgo are not allowed yet on the fire stick - also there's no Starz app or FX app like on the roku). But again, for 40 bucks, I can't really complain.
author: Nikki Jay
